content:
I've just edited the puzzle as follows:

Input
* Lines 2 to rows + 1 => Next rows lines

Constraints
* added the second and third constraints

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Easy and clean, like it.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great! It looks a little intimidating at first, but it's actually very straightforward.

Quite fun to do
Approved IMO

I only have one big qualm with the puzzle: there's no indication of how to handle multiple rows of the table. When I tried to code the solution, I had no idea what the purpose of multiple rows was, so my program failed starting from the second test case onwards as I didn't understand you needed to add the row number as well. Trying to decipher the code in my head using Test case #2 (Alphabet) to figure out what went wrong is also headache-inducing, since the case is far more complex than case #1.

I recommend using a 2x2 comparison table for the example in the prompt, and then inserting a Test Case #2 that has 2 rows and perhaps 8 characters. Incidentally, you use "line" instead of "row" in your example.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Short and clear statement. All tests work fine.
You are right, a 2x2 table would be better, and I will correct the error between row and line. Thanks for your comment.
